Member Function Documentation

virtual int32_t gaia::storage::InputStream::available ( ) [virtual]

Returns an estimated number of bytes that can be read or skipped without blocking for more input.

Returns:
the estimated number of bytes available

Reimplemented in gaia::content::AssetInputStream, gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream, and gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream.

virtual void gaia::storage::InputStream::close ( ) [virtual]

Closes this stream.

Concrete implementations of this class should free any resources during close. This implementation does nothing.

Reimplemented in gaia::content::AssetInputStream, gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream, gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream, gaia::storage::DataInputStream, and gaia::storage::ParcelFileDescriptor::AutoCloseInputStream.

virtual void gaia::storage::InputStream::mark ( int32_t  readlimit) [virtual]

Sets a mark position in this InputStream.

The parameter readLimit indicates how many bytes can be read before the mark is invalidated. Sending reset() will reposition the stream back to the marked position provided readLimit has not been surpassed.

Parameters:
readlimitthe number of bytes that can be read from this stream before the mark is invalidated.
See also:
markSupported()
reset()

Reimplemented in gaia::content::AssetInputStream, gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream, and gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream.

virtual bool gaia::storage::InputStream::markSupported ( ) [virtual]

Indicates whether this stream supports the mark() and reset() methods.

The default implementation returns false.

Returns:
always false.
See also:
mark(int32_t)
reset()

Reimplemented in gaia::content::AssetInputStream, gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream, and gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream.

virtual int32_t gaia::storage::InputStream::read ( const base::ByteArray &  buffer,
int32_t  offset,
int32_t  length 
) [virtual]

Reads at most length bytes from this stream and stores them in the byte array buffer starting at offset.

Parameters:
bufferthe byte array in which to store the bytes read.
offsetthe initial position in buffer to store the bytes read from this stream.
lengththe maximum number of bytes to store in buffer.
Returns:
the number of bytes actually read or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached.

Reimplemented in gaia::content::AssetInputStream, gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream, gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream, and gaia::storage::DataInputStream.

virtual int32_t gaia::storage::InputStream::read ( ) [pure virtual]

Reads a single byte from this stream and returns it as an integer in the range from 0 to 255.

Returns -1 if the end of the stream has been reached. Blocks until one byte has been read, the end of the source stream is detected or an exception is thrown.

Returns:
the byte read or -1 if the end of stream has been reached.

Implemented in gaia::content::AssetInputStream, gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream, and gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream.

virtual int32_t gaia::storage::InputStream::read ( const base::ByteArray &  buffer) [virtual]

Reads bytes from this stream and stores them in the byte array buffer.

Parameters:
bufferthe byte array in which to store the bytes read.
Returns:
the number of bytes actually read or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached.

Reimplemented in gaia::content::AssetInputStream, and gaia::storage::DataInputStream.

virtual void gaia::storage::InputStream::reset ( ) [virtual]

Resets this stream to the last marked location.

Reimplemented in gaia::content::AssetInputStream, gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream, and gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream.

virtual int64_t gaia::storage::InputStream::skip ( int64_t  byteCount) [virtual]

Skips at most byteCount bytes in this stream.

This method does nothing and returns 0 if byteCount is negative.

Parameters:
byteCountthe number of bytes to skip.
Returns:
the number of bytes actually skipped.

Reimplemented in gaia::content::AssetInputStream, gaia::storage::BufferedInputStream, and gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream.
